title: Vietnam nurse challenges TSA officer to do TEN press ups - before boarding flight to Arlington
text:
An 84-year-old Vietnam War nurse surprised airport passengers when she went head-to-head with a TSA officer after challenging him to do ten push-ups.

Maggie DeSanti, who was wearing her wartime uniform, was filmed performing the feat on the floor of the airport in Phoenix, Arizona - despite wearing a full leg brace.

Passersby stopped in their tracks to watch DeSanti, who gave the officer a high five for his efforts.

Maggie DeSanti, 84, is seen going head to head with a man who works for TSA on the floor of Phoenix Airport on Tuesday, in a video shared on Twitter

DeSanti was about to catch a flight to visit The Women's Memorial at Arlington National Cemetery in Virginia for the Honor Flight Arizona

The former nurse then caught a flight to Washington to see the Women's Memorial at Arlington Cemetery with non-profit organization Honor Flight Arizona.

A man filming Tuesday's event quipped: 'This is going on Facebook'

The former Vietnam nurse wore the same uniform she did back then and had to be helped up because she wears a full leg brace

The gray-haired woman tackled the challenge despite using a walking stick to get around

She and the officer had a laugh as others looked on at the physical fitness spectacle

The former nurse was thrilled to find she was now part of a display at the Women's Memorial at Arlington Cemetery.

A photo from Wednesday shows DeSanti posing with an image of herself that was part of the exhibit.

It so happened that she had the exact photograph with her, Honor Flight Chicago shared.

The groups honor WWII, Korean War and Vietnam War veterans by flying them, all-expense-paid, to DC for a day of honor, thanks & inspiration.

DeSanti looked pretty pleased with herself after the push-up challenge on Tuesday

She found a photo of herself in an exhibit for female heroes and had the same one with her
description: Maggie DeSanti, 84, is seen going head-to-head with a man who works for TSA on the floor of Phoenix Airport in Arizona on Tuesday, ahead of a trip to Virginia with the Honor Flight Network.
